description.lang: This product can be included and operated in any Z-Wave network with other Z-Wave certified devices from other manufacturers and/or other applications. All non-battery operated nodes within the network will act as repeaters regardless of vendor to increase reliability of the network. The siren support 110dB alarm sound and light flashing to threaten burglars/intruders.
Z-Wave Plus Lifeline, all nodes which associated in this group will receive the messages sent by device through lifeline.
It is controlling group, all nodes associated in this group will be controlled through BASIC_SET command by the device when device detects a tampering event.
This parameter is to set the sound sent by the alarm when giving an alarm and users can choose five different sound sources through this setting.
default alarm sound
to choose different alarm sound

Users can set through this parameter the sound volume sent when the alarm is activated, and there are 16 levels, with the adjustable scales being 0~15.0 is the minimum volume and 15 is the maximum volume.
no alarm sound
from low to high alarm sound volume setting
maximum volume
This parameter can set the duration of the alarm function after activation. Unit of time is: seconds.
Alarm Silenced (No Alarm)
Duration of the alarm in Seconds
The alarm stays on until shut down by the user.
There have 3 led pattern mode for user selecting.
LED will not turn on when there is an alarm.
The LED will blink slowly when there is an alarm.
The LED will blink rapidly when there is an alarm.
Set this configuration to 0, siren will not send an SWITCH_BINARY_REPORT to controller when an alarm is happed.
siren will not send an SWITCH_BINARY_REPORT to controller when an alarm is happed.
siren will send an SWITCH_BINARY_REPORT to controller when an alarm is happed.
This configuration sets siren alarm is enabled or disabled.
alarm disable, siren will never give an alarm.
alarm enable, siren will give an alarm when an alarm event is happened.
This configuration sets binary sensor report is enabled or disabled.
enable sensor binary report when device detects a tampering event.
disable sensor binary report when device detects a tampering event.
